com.magnet.android.mms.connection

Class ConnectionConfigManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.AbstractManager
      • com.magnet.android.mms.connection.ConnectionConfigManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.magnet.android.mms.ManagerInterface

    public final class ConnectionConfigManager
extends com.magnet.android.mms.AbstractManager
    This manager maintains the backend configurations for this application. Multiple endpoints can be configured for this application. The endpoints can be configured programatically using the #addOrReplaceConnectionConfig(String, Uri, ConfigType, Class, String) and removeConnectionConfig(String) methods. Endpoints can also be configured by defining them in assets/connection_configs.xml. This file is read upon initial startup after an upgrade or installation of the application, and the values are persisted. Any changes that are made programatically are maintained. Upon application upgrade, if the connection_configs.xml file contains new or updated configurations, the existing persisted values will be replaced with the values from the assets file. 
     <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
 <connection-configs>
     <connection-config>
         <name>default</name>
         <uri>http://www.google.com</uri>
         <type>MAGNET_REST</type>
         <auth-handler-class>com.magnet.android.mms.connection.MagnetRestAuthHandler</auth-handler-class>
         <realm>default</realm>
     </connection-config>
     <connection-config>
         <name>jumpstart</name>
         <uri>http://citest02.magnet.com:8080/rest</uri>
         <type>MAGNET_REST</type>
         <auth-handler-class>com.magnet.android.mms.connection.MagnetRestAuthHandler</auth-handler-class>
         <realm>magnet</realm>
     </connection-config>
 </connection-configs>

      • getConnectionConfig

        public ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig getConnectionConfig(String name)
        Retrieves the connection configuration for the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the configuration.
        Returns:
        The connection configuration for the specified name, or null if there is no configuration for the specified name.

      • addOrReplaceConnectionConfig

        public ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig addOrReplaceConnectionConfig(String name,
                                                                    android.net.Uri uri,
                                                                    ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig.ConfigType type,
                                                                    Class<? extends ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler> authHandlerClass,
                                                                    String realm)
        Adds a new connection configuration for this application. If an existing configuration with the same name already exists, the existing configuration will be updated and the ConnectionService will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the configuration.
        uri - The configuration URI.
        authHandlerClass - The AuthHandler implementation class for this connection configuration.
        Returns:
        A new connection configuration for this application.

      • removeConnectionConfig

        public ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig removeConnectionConfig(String name)
        Removes the connection configuration with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the configuration.
        Returns:
        The existing configuration, or null if the specified configuration doesn't exist.
